_header: Whilom there was dwelling in my country
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Friar’s Tale of the Canterbury Tales — 364 lines in rhyming couplets.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
Whilom ther was dwelling in my contrean erchedekene aman of high
                    degre…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…and praieth that this sompnour him repenteof his mysdedis or
                    that the fende him hente
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…And next / folwith his tale to angre with the Sompnour (f.
                        100v); the ffrere (RT); Here endith the ffrere is tale… (f.
                        105v)

BodBar20.First Lines:
Whilom þer was dwellyng in my contreAn Archedeken a man of
                    highe degre…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…And praieth þat þis sompnour hym repenteOf þis
                    mysdede or þat þe fende hym hent
BodBar20.Attributed Title:
…& here by gynnyth þe tale (f. 120v); The frere
                    (RT)

Bod414.First Lines:
[W]hilom ther was dwelling in my cuntreAn Archidiacon a man of high
                    degre…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…And preyith that thees somonours hem repentOf their mysdedis
                    or that the fend hem hent

Bod686.First Lines:
Whilome ther was dwellyng in my contreAn Erchdeken a man of high
                    degre…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…And prayeth þat thes sumpnours hem repenteOf her
                    misdedis er þat the fende hem hente
Bod686.Attributed Title:
…And here / begynneth hys tale (f. 86); ffrere (RT); Here endeth the
                    ffreres tale… (f. 91)

BodHatDon1.First Lines:
Whilom þere was dwelling in my contreAn Archdiacon a man of
                    hie degre…
BodHatDon1.Last Lines:
…And praieth þat þies somnours him repentOf theire
                    mysdedes or þe fende hem hent

BodLauMis600.First Lines:
Whilom þer was duelling in my countreAn Erchediaken aman of
                    hie degre…
BodLauMis600.Last Lines:
…Twelue quod she ladi seint marieSo wisli helpe me out of care
                    and synne…
BodLauMis600.Note:
III.1606-64 lost (resupplied in the seventeenth century on f.
                    100).
BodLauMis600.Attributed Title: HEre begynneth þe freres tale (f. 95); the frere (RT)

BodLauMis739.First Lines:
[S]Omtyme there was duellyng in my contreAn Archideken a man of hie
                    degre…
BodLauMis739.Last Lines:
…And preieth that this sompnour may repenteOf his mysdedis or
                    the fende hym hente

BodRawPoe141.First Lines:
Whilom was dwellyng in my contreAn archedecon a man of hye
                    degre…
BodRawPoe141.Last Lines:
…And prayeth that these sompnoures hem repentOf hur mysdedes
                    or that the fend hem hent
BodRawPoe141.Note:
III.1378, 1493-4 omitted; 1427-8 reversed; spurious line follows
                    1617.
BodRawPoe141.Attributed Title: Here bigynneth the ffreres tale (f. 142); The ffrere (RT)

CULGg427.First Lines:
…ffor subtily he hadde his expyayleThat tauȝte hym where
                    hym myȝt a vayle…
CULGg427.Last Lines:
…And panne & al but he wele hym repenteNay olde stot
                    þat is not myn entente…

CamFitzMc181.First Lines:
[W]Hilom þer was dwellynge in my CuntreAn Erchedekon a man of
                    hiȝe degre…
CamFitzMc181.Last Lines:
…He us kept fro hell þat cursed plaseNow Ihesu lord send
                    us that grace Amen
CamFitzMc181.Note:
III.1545-6, 1649-58 omitted; two spurious lines replace 1663-4 (see
                    above).
CamFitzMc181.Attributed Title:
The tale of þe ffrere (f. 147); Explicit fabula ffratris (f.
                        151v, foot)

                    thouȝt anothir…

BLEge2863.First Lines:
…Thus seide oure oost & late him telle his taleNow tellth
                    forþ & lete þe sompnour gale…
BLEge2863.Last Lines:
…Where þat sompnours han here heritageAnd god þat
                    made after his ymage…

…and preyeth þat þese sompnours hem repentof hir
                    misdedis ar þat þe fende hem hent

                    degre…
